item.title: What is Bitcoin Backed By?
item.description:
What is Bitcoin Backed By?

Wondering what bitcoin is backed by? The answer is nothing at all, but that's actually not a bad thing. Like most modern currencies bitcoin is not backed by gold or other precious commodities. In a sense, bitcoin's value is derived from our common belief that bitcoin has value.

item.title: Chronicled Launches Open Registry for Consumer IoT on Ethereum Blockchain
item.description:
Chronicled Launches Open Registry for Consumer IoT on Ethereum Blockchain

Blockchain startup Chronicled has launched the first of its kind 'open registry for Internet of Things' on the Ethereum blockchain, enabled via NFC and BLE microchips. Heralding the new open registry as a major leap in the growth and interoperability of the consumer Internet of Things, Chronicled announced the open source project under the Apache License.

item.title: Bitcoin Privacy Tool 'CoinShuffle' Sees First Transaction - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Privacy Tool 'CoinShuffle' Sees First Transaction - CoinDesk

A type of anonymous bitcoin transaction that privacy enthusiasts have been awaiting for years has finally been tested successfully. Sent on the bitcoin test network earlier this month, the transaction is possibly the first real-world implementation of CoinShuffle, a proposal that first generated excitement in April 2014 for building on existing privacy techniques in a way that doesn't rely on third parties.

item.title: Can Blockchain Change Power Industry?
item.description:
Can Blockchain Change Power Industry?

These days, there are more and more news on implementation of blockchain technology in power industry, namely in renewable sources of power (RESOPs). Last April two Brooklyn-based guys have used Ethereum's blockchain to effect transactions enabling one of them to directly sell electric power to the other.

item.title: Wall Street Goes Blockchain With Factom, Intrinio - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Wall Street Goes Blockchain With Factom, Intrinio - Bitcoin News

Blockchain-based data management platform, Also read: Dept of Homeland Security Awards $200K to Factom for ID System has announced its partnership with an application and financial data provider. The duo plans on putting Wall Street on the Factom blockchain to provide immutable and transparent US stock market data for the first time in history.

item.title: Who will play the role of miners (or nodes) in non-financial blockchain and how they get benefitted?
item.description:
Who will play the role of miners (or nodes) in non-financial blockchain and how they get benefitted?

Answer: Miners and Nodes in a blockchain are not a Who question, but a what question. A better way of thinking about mining nodes & the software is to compare them to something like a network firewall software on your modem. All they do is run on the devices.

item.title: Moscow Government to Explore Blockchain Voting - CoinDesk
item.description:
Moscow Government to Explore Blockchain Voting - CoinDesk

Government officials in Moscow today revealed plans to investigate applications of blockchain technology. According to a report by , Deputy Head of the Department of Information Technologies (DIT) of Moscow Andrey Belozerov said that the agency is exploring how to apply blockchain to various use cases, including voting fraud.
